data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is all about quality and building endurance while focusing on proper movement patterns. We’ll be doing 6 rounds of a mix of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain a steady pace and focus on form throughout each movement. Remember, it’s not just about getting through the rounds; it’s about doing each rep with intention and quality.


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • For the rower, sit with your feet secured and grab the handle. Start with your knees bent and your arms extended.
  • Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close.
  • Reverse the motion by extending your arms, leaning forward, and bending your knees.
  • For the Ski Erg, stand tall, hold the handles, and use a similar motion: pull down with your arms while driving your knees slightly forward.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the movement.
  • Use your legs to drive the motion, not just your arms.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • If you’re new to rowing or skiing, reduce the time to 2:00 or focus on technique with a lower intensity.

    • 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand facing the box with your feet hip-width apart.
  • Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through your heel, and bring the other foot up to meet it.
  • Step back down with the same foot and repeat, alternating legs.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your chest up and engage your core to maintain balance.
  • Make sure your entire foot is on the box to avoid slipping.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height.
  • If you have knee issues, consider doing step-ups without weights or using a platform instead.

    • 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly pointed out. Place the kettlebell between your feet.
  • Hinge at your hips and bend your knees to grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  • Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up along your body to your chin, keeping your elbows high.
  • Lower the kettlebell back down and repeat.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your back flat and chest up during the hinge.
  • Use your legs to initiate the pull, not just your arms.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form.

    • 4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

  • **Technique Steps:**
  • Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back with your arms extended.
  • Grab the rings and lean back, keeping your body straight.
  • Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together, and then lower back down.

  • **Form Tips:**
  • Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  • Avoid letting your hips sag or your back arch.

  • **Scaling/Modifications:**
  • Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder.
  • If rings are too challenging, you can substitute with inverted rows using a barbell.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat:**
  • Use a lighter kettlebell (16/8 kg) and focus on form and technique.

  • **Train:**
  • Use a moderate kettlebell (20/12 kg) and aim for consistent pacing throughout the rounds.

  • **Compete:**
  • Use a heavier kettlebell (24/16 kg) and push your limits while maintaining quality reps.

    • Strategy Advice

  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. It’s better to go a little slower and keep your form than to rush and risk injury.
  • Break up the movements if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows, to maintain quality.
  • Stay hydrated and listen to your body; if something feels off, don’t hesitate to scale back or take a breather.

    • Let’s get after it, everyone! Remember, quality over quantity today. Enjoy the workout!

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16

Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8

--- AI EXPLANATION --- ## Workout Overview Hey everyone! Today’s WOD is all about quality and building endurance while focusing on proper movement patterns. We’ll be doing 6 rounds of a mix of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain a steady pace and focus on form throughout each movement. Remember, it’s not just about getting through the rounds; it’s about doing each rep with intention and quality. ## Workout Components ### 1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00) - **Technique Steps:** - For the rower, sit with your feet secured and grab the handle. Start with your knees bent and your arms extended. - Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your elbows close. - Reverse the motion by extending your arms, leaning forward, and bending your knees. - For the Ski Erg, stand tall, hold the handles, and use a similar motion: pull down with your arms while driving your knees slightly forward. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the movement. - Use your legs to drive the motion, not just your arms. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - If you’re new to rowing or skiing, reduce the time to 2:00 or focus on technique with a lower intensity. ### 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand facing the box with your feet hip-width apart. - Step up onto the box with one foot, driving through your heel, and bring the other foot up to meet it. - Step back down with the same foot and repeat, alternating legs. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your chest up and engage your core to maintain balance. - Make sure your entire foot is on the box to avoid slipping. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lower box if you’re not comfortable with the height. - If you have knee issues, consider doing step-ups without weights or using a platform instead. ### 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly pointed out. Place the kettlebell between your feet. - Hinge at your hips and bend your knees to grab the kettlebell with both hands. - Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up along your body to your chin, keeping your elbows high. - Lower the kettlebell back down and repeat. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your back flat and chest up during the hinge. - Use your legs to initiate the pull, not just your arms. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Use a lighter kettlebell or perform the movement without weight to focus on form. ### 4. Ring Rows (10 reps) - **Technique Steps:** - Set the rings at a height that allows you to lean back with your arms extended. - Grab the rings and lean back, keeping your body straight. - Pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together, and then lower back down. - **Form Tips:** - Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. - Avoid letting your hips sag or your back arch. - **Scaling/Modifications:** - Adjust the height of the rings to make the movement easier or harder. - If rings are too challenging, you can substitute with inverted rows using a barbell. ## Loading and Rep-Modification Options - **Sweat:** - Use a lighter kettlebell (16/8 kg) and focus on form and technique. - **Train:** - Use a moderate kettlebell (20/12 kg) and aim for consistent pacing throughout the rounds. - **Compete:** - Use a heavier kettlebell (24/16 kg) and push your limits while maintaining quality reps. ### Strategy Advice - Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. It’s better to go a little slower and keep your form than to rush and risk injury. - Break up the movements if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows, to maintain quality. - Stay hydrated and listen to your body; if something feels off, don’t hesitate to scale back or take a breather. Let’s get after it, everyone! Remember, quality over quantity today. Enjoy the workout!
